analyzed: yathā abhraiḥ arka raśmibhyaḥ darpaṇam ca malena ca
translated: Just as a mirror is covered by clouds from the sun's rays, and by dust,

original: sphaṭikaṃ pāṃsunā yad vat tathā jñānaṃ tamo vṛtam /
analyzed: sphaṭikam pāṃsunā yat vat tathā jñānam tamaḥ vṛtam
translated: so is knowledge covered by darkness.

analyzed: ajñānāt dṛśyate jantuḥ guṇa pāśaiḥ tu yantritaḥ
translated: Due to ignorance, a living being is seen to be bound by the fetters of qualities.

analyzed: karma upabhogam bhuñjīta tiṣṭhate sva anna yoniṣu
translated: He enjoys the fruits of his actions and remains in his own wombs.

original: na deho mriyate bhuṅkte karmabhogeti tasya vai // //
analyzed: na dehaḥ mriyate bhuṅkte karma bhoga iti tasya vai
translated: The body does not die, but enjoys the fruits of his actions.

analyzed: pati jñānam prabuddhaḥ tu sarvajñaḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: The awakened one, who has the knowledge of the Lord, is omniscient and the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: prāpnoti jñānam abhyāsāt jñānāt muktaḥ tu mocakaḥ
translated: One attains knowledge through practice, and through knowledge, one becomes liberated and a liberator of others.

original: caṇḍālo hīnajanmā ca śvapaco vāpi phukkasaḥ /🔽sarvagaṃ paramaṃ devaṃ hetūpādhivivarjitam // //
analyzed: caṇḍālaḥ hīna janmā ca śvapacaḥ vā api phukkasaḥ  sarvagam paramam devam hetu upādhi vivarjitam
translated: Even a Chandala, of low birth, a dog-cook, or a sweeper,🔽who truly knows the Supreme God, who is all-pervading and free from limiting adjuncts,

original: samyag jānāti yaścandra sa yogī cottamomataḥ /
analyzed: samyak jānāti yaḥ candra sa yogī ca uttamaḥ mataḥ
translated: is a yogi and the best, O Moon.

original: p / vipro vā mūḍhabuddhiśca ajñāna spṛśya eva saḥ // //
analyzed: vipraḥ vā mūḍha buddhiḥ ca ajñāna spṛśyaḥ eva saḥ
translated: Even a Brahmin with a deluded mind, who is touched by ignorance,

original: caṇḍālo yadi vā jñānī tasmai deyaṃ pratigraham /
analyzed: caṇḍālaḥ yadi vā jñānī tasmai deyam pratigraham
translated: if a Chandala knows the truth, to him should be given alms.

original: tasya hastā tu vai grāhya sa ca pūjyo yathā hyaham // //
analyzed: tasya tu vai grāhya sa ca pūjyaḥ yathā hi aham
translated: His hand should be grasped and he should be worshipped just as I am.

original: bhrāntiṃ tyajasva vai candra hyetajjñānaṃ samabhya sa /
analyzed: bhrāntim tyajasva vai candra hi etat jñānam sa
translated: O Moon, abandon this delusion and attain this knowledge.

analyzed: ajñānāt ca kriyā kāṇḍam jñānāt karma kṣayaḥ bhavet
translated: And from ignorance, the rites and duties are performed, but from knowledge, actions would be destroyed.

original: niyamo na ca vā kālo bhrāntimetāṃ parityaja /
analyzed: niyamaḥ na ca vā kālaḥ bhrāntim etām parityaja
translated: And there is no restriction or time, abandon this delusion.

analyzed: ajñānāt karma pāśaiḥ tu prakṛtaiḥ badhyate punar
translated: Again, one is bound by the original fetters of action due to ignorance.

analyzed: prabuddhānām sadā candra sarva jñāna mayam jagat
translated: O Moon, for the ever-enlightened ones, the world is full of all knowledge.

original: sarvaṃ jagat svadehaṃ vā parānandena pūritam // //
analyzed: sarvam jagat sva deham vā parānandena pūritam
translated: The entire world or one's own body is filled with supreme bliss.

original: sarvaśaṅkāḥ parityajya śūnyabhūmiṃ bhavet tu saḥ /
analyzed: sarva śaṅkāḥ parityajya śūnya bhūmim bhavet tu saḥ
translated: Abandonning all doubts, one becomes the void ground.

original: na kālo na yamaḥ kaścidetā bāla vibhīṣakāḥ // //
analyzed: na kālaḥ na yamaḥ kaścid etāḥ bāla vibhīṣakāḥ
translated: There is no time, no Yama, these are mere frightening tales for the ignorant.

original: sarvopamā na hīnasya kalpanā rahitasya ca /
analyzed: sarvā upamā na hīnasya kalpanā rahitasya ca
translated: For one who is not inferior and free from conceptualization, all comparisons are not applicable.

original: p / kutaḥ kālaḥ kuto mṛtyurnarake śāsanāḥ katham // //
analyzed: kutas kālaḥ kutas mṛtyuḥ narake śāsanāḥ katham  /
translated: From where is time, from where is death, and how are there punishments in hell?

original: sarvaṃ śūnyamayaṃ dhyāyeccharīrā vayavaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: sarvam śūnya mayam dhyāyet śarīrāḥ vayavam ca yat
translated: One should meditate on everything as being full of emptiness, including one's own body.

original: kāyaṃ śūnyamayaṃ kṛtvā na kiñcidapi carcayet // //
analyzed: kāyam śūnya mayam kṛtvā na kiñcid api carcayet  /
translated: Having made the body full of emptiness, one should not think of anything at all.

analyzed: vikalpa yonim majjanti jantavaḥ
translated: Beings sink in the womb of conceptualization due to primordial nature.

analyzed: guṇa pāśaiḥ nibadhyante mūḍhāḥ pāpa ratāḥ punar
translated: The deluded ones engaged in sin are bound again by the nooses of qualities.

original: yatra yatra hi yonyantarjāyante te svakarmaṇā /
analyzed: yatra yatra hi yoni antar jāyante te sva karmaṇā
translated: Wherever they are born in different wombs due to their own actions,

original: tatra tatrājñā bhāvatvaṃ paśūnāṃ syāt sadodūpa // //
analyzed: tatra tatra ājñā bhāva tvam paśūnām syāt
translated: there, O Kapila, the ignorance of the bound souls would always be.

original: karmāṇi kasya vai deva hyetan me vada tattvataḥ /
analyzed: karmāṇi kasya vai deva hi etat me vada tattvataḥ
translated: O God, whose are these actions? Tell me this truthfully.

original: yadi jīvo hi muktaśca nīrūpaḥ khasvarūpakaḥ // //
analyzed: yadi jīvaḥ hi muktaḥ ca nīrūpaḥ kha svarūpakaḥ
translated: If the soul is liberated, and is formless, having the nature of space,

original: nīrūpasya kathaṃ karma śūnyabhūtasya vai prabho /
analyzed: nīrūpasya katham karma śūnya bhūtasya vai prabho
translated: how can there be action for the formless one, who is essentially empty, O Lord?

original: etadicchāmyahaṃ śrotuṃ tvat pramādāt kapāla bhṛt // //
analyzed: etat icchāmi aham śrotum tvad pramādāt kapāla bhṛt
translated: I wish to hear this, O bearer of the skull, out of your grace.

original: p / śūnyasya dviguṇasyaiva karma tasya karoti kim /
analyzed: śūnyasya dviguṇasya eva karma tasya karoti kim
translated: What action does the empty one, who is twofold, perform?

analyzed: prakṛtiḥ guṇa saṃpūrṇā mriyate jāyate tathā
translated: Prakriti, full of qualities, dies and is born again.

original: kṛta karma tathātmīyaṃ yathāsau bhuñjate punaḥ /
analyzed: kṛta karma tathā ātmīyam yathā asau bhuñjate punar
translated: And the soul enjoys its own actions again.

original: na jīvo bhuñjate karma na cāsau prakṛtirguṇaiḥ // //
analyzed: na jīvaḥ bhuñjate karma na ca asau prakṛtiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: The soul does not enjoy actions, nor is it bound by the qualities of Prakriti.

original: badhyate na ca vā mukto nāsthāyī sthāna varjitaḥ /
analyzed: badhyate na ca vā muktaḥ na asthāyī sthāna varjitaḥ
translated: It is neither bound nor liberated, it is not permanent, nor is it devoid of a place.
It is omniscient, omnipresent, the witness, having the nature of space, the mind of space, and moves in space.

analyzed: iti me yoginaḥ dṛṣṭāḥ brahma viṣṇu indra bhārgavāḥ
translated: Thus have I seen the yogis, Brahma, Vishnu, Indra, and Bhargava.

original: te pi pra /mohamāpannā jīvaṃ jñānavidhau sadā // //
analyzed: te pi pramoham āpannāḥ jīvam jñāna vidhau sadā
translated: They too have fallen into delusion, always in the method of knowing the living soul.

analyzed: satyam ca kathayiṣyāmi śṛṇu
translated: I shall speak the truth, listen first to the king of the twice-born.

analyzed: pravṛti artham tu bhūtānām prakṛta artham asaṃsthitaḥ
translated: But for the sake of the engagement of beings, I am not established in the original purpose.

analyzed: tathā ābaddham jagat sarvam mūtremaṇi gaṇāḥ iva
translated: Thus the entire world is bound, like a group of gems in a necklace.

analyzed: ādhāra dharaṇī śakti raśirā aham sa rūpiṇī
translated: The power of the supporting earth, I am in the form of the head.

original: tanmadhye saṃsthito jīvaḥ kharūpī vyāpakaḥ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: tad madhye saṃsthitaḥ jīvaḥ kharūpī vyāpakaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: In the middle of that, the living soul, in the form of space, is the all-pervading lord.

original: yathā veśmāntara gataṃ nabhaḥ sarvagataṃ sthitam // //
analyzed: yathā veśma antara gatam nabhaḥ sarva gatam sthitam
translated: Just as space, though present everywhere, is destroyed by the destruction of the house,

analyzed: veśma pātena naṣṭaḥ asau jīvaḥ ca ādhāra pātane
translated: in the same way, the living soul is destroyed by the fall of the support.

original: tad vat sarvagataṃ brahma sarvatraiva susaṃsthitam // //
analyzed: tat vat sarva gatam brahma sarvatra eva su saṃsthitam
translated: Similarly, Brahman, though present everywhere, is well-established everywhere.

analyzed: tāraka indra tyaja bhrāntim kim anyat kathaya mama te
translated: O lord of stars, give up delusion, what else shall I tell you?

analyzed: atyanta gahanam deva rahasyam bhuvi durlabham
translated: O god, this secret is extremely profound, difficult to obtain on earth.

analyzed: tvat prasādāt mayā ajñātam jīva lakṣaṇam uttamam
translated: By your grace, I have known the excellent characteristics of the living soul.

original: adyame saphalaṃ janma adya me saphalaṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: adi ame sa phalam janma adya me sa phalam tapaḥ
translated: Today my birth is fruitful, today my penance is fruitful.

analyzed: adya jātaḥ asmi aham deva jñānena anena bhairava
translated: Today I am born, O god Bhairava, by this knowledge.

original: mahatāstotrarājena devadevo maheśvaraḥ /🔽toṣito vai mahādevaścandreṇa ca yathā kṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: mahatā stotra rājena devadevaḥ maheśvaraḥ  toṣitaḥ vai mahādevaḥ candreṇa ca yathā kṛtaḥ
translated: The god of gods, Maheshvara, was pleased by Chandra with a great king of hymns.🔽Mahadeva was satisfied, and he did as he was asked.

original: p / parituṣṭena devena varaṃ dattvā yathāvidhi /
analyzed: parituṣṭena devena varam dattvā yathāvidhi
translated: The satisfied god gave a boon according to the rules.

original: jñānabhogī ca madvākyāt pūrvoktamyā mṛtodbhava // //🔽mahābhāgi bhaviṣyaiṣā metanmedattavāndharam /
analyzed: jñāna bhogī ca mad vākyāt mṛta udbhava  mahābhāgi bhaviṣyā eṣā mā etat me dattavān dharam
translated: By my words, he will be a knower of enjoyment, and as mentioned before, he will be born again after death.🔽O greatly fortunate one, he will become this, and I have given him this boon.

analyzed: evam uktvā yadā devaḥ virarāma maheśvaraḥ
translated: When the god Maheshvara ceased speaking,

analyzed: candraḥ ca prāptavān jñānam candra jñānam atas smṛtam
translated: and Chandra attained knowledge, this is known as Chandrajnana.

analyzed: bhaktāya idam pradātavyam śraddhā dānāya dhīmate
translated: This should be given to a devotee, to a wise one with faith in giving.

analyzed: yaḥ nindayati mohena idam śāstram a gauravam
translated: The foolish one who out of delusion disrespects this scripture,

analyzed: sa mūḍhaḥ sarvadā tiṣṭet ātma jñānena saṃyutaḥ
translated: he will always remain deluded, devoid of self-knowledge.
